name: clmsca
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wceq(c1, co(ccnfld, cress, c2)))

stmt.origin: simp2bi(wcel(c0, cclm), wceq(c1, co(ccnfld, cress, c2)), wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c2, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld)))
stmt.pretty: simp2bi(c0 ∈ CMod, c1 =(CCfld[|`s]c2), c0 ∈ LMod, c2 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wceq(c1, co(ccnfld, cress, c2)))
-| wb(wcel(c0, cclm), w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wceq(c1, co(ccnfld, cress, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 =(CCfld[|`s]c2))
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod ↔(c0 ∈ LMod ∧ c1 =(CCfld[|`s]c2)∧ c2 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wceq(c1, co(ccnfld, cress, c2)))
-| wb(wcel(c0, cclm), w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wceq(c1, co(ccnfld, cress, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld))))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 =(CCfld[|`s]c2))
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod ↔(c0 ∈ LMod ∧ c1 =(CCfld[|`s]c2)∧ c2 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cclm), w3a(wcel(c0, clmod), wceq(c1, co(ccnfld, cress, c2)), wcel(c2, cfv(csubrg, ccnfld))))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csca, c0))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c1))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod ↔(c0 ∈ LMod ∧ c1 =(CCfld[|`s]c2)∧ c2 ∈(SubRing ` CCfld)))
⊣ c1 =(Scalar ` c0)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wceq(c1, co(ccnfld, cress, c2)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csca, c0))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c1))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c1 =(CCfld[|`s]c2))
⊣ c1 =(Scalar ` c0)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c1)

comment: The ring of scalars ` F ` of a subcomplex module is the restriction of the field of complex numbers to the base set of ` F ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Oct-2015.)
